website_summaries.verdict: If you're just looking for an anchor, this is a durable and affordable option.
pros: Comes in a wide variety of weights, from 1.5 to 17.5 pounds
Works best with coral, stone, heavy weeds, and surfaces where it can get a bite
cons: This is just the anchor itself
you'll have to add your own line and marker buoy
Some buyers say the locking slide comes unlocked too easily

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it. Anchored just as described
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend it. Anchored just as described, works brilliantly on my 2014 150 Supersport Boston Whaler (1,100 lbs boat). BTW I'm an experienced boater and have used many anchor types on many vessels.. THIS ONE STORES EASILY and bites well, great no-nonsense product.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: A lot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Its an anchor not a race car. It is cast and that is all the work that it needs, no grinding or polishing up the rough edges, it's 10.00 for heavens sake. I can easily remove a few of the rough edges with a grinder if need be. It works fine, actually great. Comes with a nice shackle for connecting a line to. For 10.00 its a steal. You could pay the manufacturer to polish it up then the price would be double.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: 13# on a 21’ Mastercraft. It holds.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more to tell really. Was considering a box anchor but it was suggested I try one of these. At less than 1/2 the price of a box anchor, I gave it a shot. I won’t be buying a box anchor. I’ve used this 4 times and the boat doesn’t budge.
customer_reviews.author: APersonWhoBoughtAThing

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiny anchor for a tiny boat or raft
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a large inflatable raft to keep from drifting too far out into the lake when I'm napping in the sun. It works well. I have the smallest 1.5 lb anchor and about 12 feet of rope. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tomazic

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be of good quality
customer_reviews.text: This anchor arrived on time and appears to be of pretty good quality. I don't know how much you can say about an anchor other than it's a chunk of metal. I will know more later about how well it grabs but from what I can see, it should do well. The grabber arms have a good range of motion and are long enough to dig into the bottom material about 8 to 10 inches which should hold pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: JoPho

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor.
customer_reviews.text: I only knocked a star off because occasionally the piece that keeps it closed comes undone. Trying to pull an open anchor out of my live well is a pain in the rear, but overall it have failed to grip yet. Definitely could have gotten away with a 3.5 lbs anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Vardon

customer_reviews.title: Works on all bottoms and in current
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 7lb anchor for my 16ft aluminum hull boat and this anchor has worked great. I fish over every type of sea bottom rock,sand, muck and seabed’s. This anchor has kept me in place when the current has been moving as well. I’d suggest getting an anchor chain to help with keeping you in place but I haven’t had any issues with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ryan Young

customer_reviews.title: ummm, yea, that'll do...
customer_reviews.text: Got the 17 pound model for my 19 ft bowrider. It is totally manageable if you're a reasonably healthy person, stores just fine on the boat, and stops the boat wherever you drop it, even in a strong river current. Don't bother with the smaller ones, get the big daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen G Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even hold an inflatable from moving
customer_reviews.text: It's basically a neat paperweight. Maybe on a bottom that's not sand it will work, but definitely not on sand. I gave it 3 stars simply because it may work in some environments but my experience was completely zero holding power.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use!
customer_reviews.text: A grapnel broke off the anchor the 2nd time I used it. I bought it to use with my iSUP for fishing and it worked great the first time. The second time, I pulled it up when I was ready to move and a grapnel just fell off and sunk to the bottom. Both uses were on muddy bottoms, not rock. At this rate I'll have no grapnels left in a short amount of time. You can see in the photo that the piece of metal that holds the grapnel in place is broken off. Cheap, soft metal? If the seller is reading this, please contact me, I'd like a replacement or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Boat Anchor and Large Hanging Basket Suooprt!
customer_reviews.text: My Staghorn Fern out grew its metal basket since we moved to Houston. The metal basket and hanging chains were rusted beyond repair and would not support the weight of this behemoth. What to do? Bought the anchor and ran it up the center with the anchor blades as support to the bottom of the plant. Attached a welded link stainless steel chain and hoisted it back up into it’s tree. PERFECT! Not its intended purpose but great for me in this application.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: A little loose but it will work
customer_reviews.text: This anchor is for my 21' deck boat. When I took it out of the box I noticed it's a little more loose than I thought it would be but that's not a problem. It will still go in the water and it will hold it on place.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Even though I knew the weight of what I had ordered I was still surprised to see how small this actually was. I ordered this for our big floats for my kids to jump off of in our pond but unfortunately it was not strong enough to hold them down and seemed cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Folds up small, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed little grapnel anchor. It folds up nice and is quickly set to use. Just right for canoe or kayak - maybe even a John boat.
customer_reviews.author: RuggedShark

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great anchor. Easier to store than most standard anchors. Very heavy so make sure toes are out of the way when dropping flukes! 🤨. Bought for my pontoon boat. Fits neatly in the bow storage bin.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Miller

customer_reviews.title: It is bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure of size to order, this 18" is big, but will work perfect for our 18' Magnum Happy with our purchase and price.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my 14' boat. Great anchors, grabs the bottom with very little effort! Locks in place with flukes down and in the stores position.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Clevis' aren't the best quality but can be easily replaced with some better ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 15' Center Console really well even in a decent wind. Clevis' aren't the best quality but can be easily replaced with some better ones from a hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Somero

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I inadvertently let my last anchor go when I sold my boat in the spring, so I bought this one and I didn't have to leave to go to the nearest boat store (30 mi away) and it arrived in 2 days! Can't beat that. And it came with a few feet of anchor chain and shackels!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this anchor catches and holds my boat a lot easier than my other one that we lost at bottom of lake. 17.5 lbs for 20’ boat, overkill. But, hey going to catch and not go anywhere. Held our boat and 24’ boat no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its huge
customer_reviews.text: this thing is very big i would recommend going down a size and making sure to use with a chain
customer_reviews.author: Welder guy

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: Great little anchor for kayaks or kick boats. Can be left closed or open on very windy days.
customer_reviews.author: Deadeye10

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have used this twice as a secondary anchor for 21' deckboats and bowriders in FL intercoastal waters. It works well to help stabilize the boat on windy days.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor
customer_reviews.text: Got for my kayak, work great when you wanna drop anchor to fish a spot
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: give it a try
customer_reviews.text: Use it with a 10 foot jon boat need something small this is the right size
customer_reviews.author: Hot momma

customer_reviews.title: This should work!
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied. I’m using this as a weight to tie to my float so I can stop drifting and crashing into the shore. :) I purchased the 5.5lb. It’s about a foot long. Really easy to lock.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Good anchor for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, fully galvanized. Good holding power for weight. Fold up construction makes for very convenient storage in a smaller area.
customer_reviews.author: ihockeynut

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This anchor not only works well. It also saves space on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: JA Eberle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect in front hold. Held fast on 15 foot Wahoo
customer_reviews.author: WINDSTOCK

customer_reviews.title: Like it and fact it folds down
customer_reviews.text: Like it and fact it folds down...the lock nut is very wobbly and I wonder if it easily comes loose when it moves underwater?
customer_reviews.author: Lenzerini

customer_reviews.title: I liked the weight 1
customer_reviews.text: I liked the weight 1.5 lbs. Use it with my one man pontoon boat. Held vey well while floating on the Big Hole south of Butte Mt. Seems nearly perfect with this size of boat . It allows me to anchor at good spots for Fly Fishing. Might need a 3lb. for faster current. So far very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schlosser

customer_reviews.title: Small size and folding arms are perfect for kayak where room is at a premium.
customer_reviews.text: 3 lb. grapnel folding anchor came in a day late which is ok by me. It should be perfect for my 11 ft. Kayak. Can't wait for weather to warm so I can try it out.
customer_reviews.author: scott h bailey

customer_reviews.title: works great for a canoe
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our canoe on lakes. Much better than what we had before.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Well made, colapsable for easy storage.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, plenty of weight for boat up to 15', stores away in small place.
customer_reviews.author: Al G.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Use it to hold duck decoys in place, have yet to use it in fast currents or where there’s a lot of waves. Works as expected and sure it will work fine as I have used similar ones in past. Packs up small which is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Folds up nicely and stores away. Added a cable tie to augment the designed closure. On time and as described. Would recommend and order again
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: I've only used it once but it work great. I like how I can fold it up ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once but it work great. I like how I can fold it up for easy stowage.

customer_reviews.title: Small boats and kayaks
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it will be fine I have not tried it yet good for small boats and kayaks

customer_reviews.title: Held Tandem Kayak sturdy in heavy winds for lunch break, 5lb
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Get a vinyl rope with carabiner also. Great value

customer_reviews.title: Compact yet effective
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product held boat at 3.5 pounds better than my 10 pounder

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as stated and I love it. Use while fishing in Kayak.

customer_reviews.title: service and delivery was fast.
customer_reviews.text: this anchor is great for me, for one if I keep it closed it acts as a wate in shallow water. for two in deep water, I can open it up and it will keep me anchored. thanks

customer_reviews.title: Very solid anchor. Zero compliants.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid anchor. Durable, functional, and accommodates the "anchor release zip tie method" (or whatever you'd call it) very well.

customer_reviews.title: Chintzy

customer_reviews.title: Tried and Tested for 5✴️
customer_reviews.text: Great for shallow lakes where rounded weighted anchors won’t hold in strong winds. This Bad Boy digs in and stays.
customer_reviews.author: mrose5019

customer_reviews.title: Best anchor I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for an anchor that holds in High winds this one works

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's suppose to do... Stops me from drifting away ;)

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: It's just what I needed, I love how compact it is for storage. I'm using it for an inflatable boat. Works great.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - well made

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this anchor. I have a 3,400 pound 20 foot long boat & this anchor holds it. Two claws always engage.

customer_reviews.title: The 13# model is much larger than the picture.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I use the replacement, I will let you know.

customer_reviews.title: Good, as described.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Intex Excursion 5
customer_reviews.text: Bought this anchor for my new Intex Excursion 5 and it worked perfectly. Even on windy days, it holds us exactly where I want us.

product_meta.title: Crown Sporting Goods Galvanized Folding Grapnel Boat Anchors - Choose The Best Weight for Your Watercraft, Up to 17.5 lbs
product_meta.description:
Get hooked with these grapnel boat anchors by Crown Sporting Goods. Made from galvanized steel, these anchors can withstand extreme weather conditions without breaking or corroding. The prongs lock into place with a simple twist and easily fold for compact storage. Grapnel anchors are designed for short-term, inland use for areas with low current. They are great for small boats like kayaks, canoes, inflatables, and dinghies. Their four-prong structure is perfect to secure your boat in heavy weeds, coral, stone, and gravel. Available in 7 different weights, you're sure to find the right size for you: 1.5lbs, 3lbs, 5.5lbs, 7lbs, 9lbs, 13lbs, and 17.5lbs.

Why You'll Love It:

Grapnel boat anchors are the most simple and inexpensive solution for securing a small, inland watercraft. Their prongs can hook to nearly any jagged surface below the water, which makes them a great choice for fishing, camping, and recreational water sports. These anchors are also great for retrieving items that have gone overboard. Coming in a variety of sizes, you're sure to find one that's perfect for you.
feature_bullets: Grapnel Boat Anchors by Crown Sporting Goods
Made from long-lasting and corrosion-resistant galvanized steel
Easily locks into place for a secure hold and folds for compact storage when not in use
Great for short-term, inland use of small boats like kayaks, canoes, inflatables, and dinghies
Best used in coral, stone, heavy weeds, gravel, and other hooking surfaces in low currents
